Object oriented php

Features of Object oriented

  • encapsulation (gurded by adding visibility filter)
  • inheritance (child class extends parents class)
  • polymorphism (a class implements lot of interface)
  • overriding (child class can overwrite parent class properties and method)
  • overloading (object can set new properties and method despite not defining inside class)

accessing properties and method without instantiating a class

by making static, we can call properties and method without instantiating a class.

class className {
  public static $properties = 'some value';
  public static function method() {
    return 'some dummy return';
  }
  const CONSTNAME = 'some constant value';
}
className::$properties;
className::method();

Or we can access constant also using :: operator;

className::CONSTNAME;

Whenever we access property or method inside a static method we have to use self rather than $this . Incase of parent references use parent keyword

mvc in php

R
C <======>  M
V

mvc just follow division of the work paradigm. We will split our code in 3 different area. Mvc is very popular software paradigm. Most of php framework like Laravel, codeignite, yii, cake php, symfony following mvc paradigm. Its very simple to understand.

view

view will show view part like html, iterating data and view for end user.

controller

Controller do logic part and getting data from model and show view page

model

Model is a data layer. Itâ€™s responsible for managing data

Routing

Route will determine which controller will be loaded based on url route.
